h1: Calories in Vodka and Tonic Water
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) vodka + 6 fl oz (177 ml) regular tonic water; no added garnishes or sweeteners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, mixer type, and preparation; alcohol content affects totals. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard vodka and tonic has ~165 kcal, mostly from alcohol and tonic sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic water instead of regular
Double the vodka (3 fl oz total)

faqs.q: How many calories in a vodka tonic?
faqs.a: About 165 kcal for a standard 1.5 oz vodka + 6 oz tonic serving.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in vodka and tonic water?
faqs.a: Yes, ~16.5 g carbs from the tonic's sugars; vodka adds none.

faqs.q: What's the calorie difference with diet tonic?
faqs.a: Swapping to diet tonic reduces it to ~95 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Does vodka tonic have protein or fat?
faqs.a: No significant protein or fat; calories come from alcohol and tonic carbs.

faqs.q: How does tonic water brand affect calories?
faqs.a: Brands vary; regular tonic has 70-90 kcal per 6 oz due to sugar content.
